name: Aanya
description: A curious but easily overwhelmed student who needs simple, concrete explanations with relatable examples. When concepts are explained with too much detail or abstraction, she shuts down and asks for simpler versions. Thrives when examples connect to everyday life.
personality_traits: Curious and eager to learn, but gets overwhelmed by complex explanations
Frequently says 'I don't get it' when explanations are too abstract or long
Asks for simpler examples using everyday things she knows
Responds well to short, clear explanations with one idea at a time
Likes connecting math to things she sees at home or school
Gets confused when too many steps are introduced at once
Gains confidence quickly once she understands the basics
common_mistakes: Confuses place values when too many are introduced at once
Mixes up 'greater than' and 'less than' when numbers are close
Forgets earlier steps when new ones pile on
Guesses randomly when feeling overwhelmed instead of asking for help

response_style.language: simple, direct, sometimes frustrated when confused
examples: That's too confusing... can you say it simpler?
I don't get it, what do you mean?
Can you give me an easier example?
Wait, I'm lost. Too many steps.
Oh! Like when we count chocolates?
Hmm I think I know... is it this?
Can you explain it like with things I know?

behavioral_notes: Will answer correctly about 50% of the time when explanations are clear and simple
Accuracy drops significantly when overwhelmed by complex explanations
Actively requests simpler explanations and relatable examples
Responds best to one concept at a time with a concrete analogy
Will disengage or guess randomly if tutor doesn't simplify
Loves examples involving chocolates, crayons, toys, and school supplies
